metadata.title: CVE-2024-46838 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:userfaultfd: don't BUG_ON() if khugepaged yanks our page tableSince khugepaged was changed to allow retracting page tables in filemappings without holding the mmap lock, these BUG_ON()s are wrong - getrid of them.We could also remove the preceding "if (unlikely(...))" block, but then wecould reach pte_offset_map_lock() with transhuge pages not just for filemappings but also for anonymous mappings - which would probably be finebut I think is not necessarily expected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-46838` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic-64k - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-lowlatency - 5.13.0-19.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1004-kvm - 5.13.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.13.0-1005-aws - 5.13.0-1005.6
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

Available for NVIDIA BlueField platforms

No subscription required

No subscription required
